alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 10:04PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, southwestern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado and Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado through 1030 PM MDT... At 1003 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking multiple outflows from thunderstorms in Eastern Colorado. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, southwestern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado and Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Joes, Abarr and Kirk. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 391 and 429. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
